thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal were lacking against Chelsea as Gunner fan unrest goes up another notch
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal were lacking against Chelsea as Gunner fan unrest goes up another notch

author: John Cross
title: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal were lacking against Chelsea as Gunner fan unrest goes up another notch
text:
Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal were lacking against Chelsea as Gunner fan unrest goes up another notch Another defeat for the Gunners has effectively ended any lingering title hopes Share The Gunners were comprehensibly beaten at Stamford Bridge (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Outside Stamford Bridge there were two guys with a camera and a microphone. 
“The only way he is going to leave is if he walks and he’s not going to walk,” shouted the angry Arsenal fan into the camera as he prepared to become a YouTube sensation. 
A group of Chelsea fans walked by, laughing their heads off. The rest of football tend to laugh at the Arsenal soap opera which is played out on Twitter and Arsenal Fan TV. 
To be fair, it is brilliant entertainment. Everyone is entitled to a view. Except that the Arsenal fans seem so wrapped up in their anger and despair that they miss the fact that other fans are ridiculing them. 
It used to be played out in a pub with mates. Now it’s on social media and, without doubt, Arsenal’s latte sipping classes and spoilt little rich kids seem to shout loudest. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsenal fan releases anti-Wenger grime track Share this video Watch Next 
Arsenal’s away fans are a better barometer and when they lose faith then the club needs to listen because it does feel like Groundhog Day. All they need is to get Bill Murray to play Arsene Wenger. 
Another season flirting with the title race, all over by February. The chase is on for the top four and heading for the exit door in the Champions League at last 16 stage. 
Sound familiar? Yes. Because it happens most seasons. And it is hard to know whether Arsenal can kick on under Wenger and win the title again. 
The counter argument is that they have finished in the top four under Wenger for 20 years, won trophies and that should not be dismissed as an easy achievement. There is no guarantee his successor will be better. Eddie Howe or Jurgen Klopp did not fare much better on Saturday. The Arsene Out brigade were in full voice (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) The Gunners title drought looks set to continue (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Everything points to Wenger signing a new contract. A new deal is on the table and Wenger is even involved in planning for their pre-season and contract negotiations for the likes of Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez. 
But there is only so much anyone can take. Sat up in the stands with the Chelsea fans, Wenger took stick but far more hurtful was that he could see the game slipping away and his team unable to compete. 
TV pundit Gary Neville was highly critical of Wenger substituting Francis Coquelin, perhaps unaware the French midfielder went into the game nursing a hamstring. Another midfield injury to worry about. 
Wenger is painfully loyal to players, arguably to his own detriment. Wenger blamed missing out on N’Golo Kante because Chelsea could pay more. It is more likely the reality is that he did not want to block Coquelin’s progress. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
